'''Neowin.net''' is a [[Microsoft]] enthusiast<ref>http://www.theregister.co.uk/2003/03/07/neowin_net_downed_by_ms/</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=McLaughlin |first=Kevin |url=http://www.crn.com/blogs-op-ed/the-channel-wire/215900579/report-microsoft-to-launch-windows-7-rc-in-may.htm;jsessionid=UFQg2byY6026BJkb5gUZIw**.ecappj02 |title=Report: Microsoft To Launch Windows 7 RC In May |publisher=Crn.com |date=2009-03-16 |accessdate=2011-03-12}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.windows7password.net/microsoft-offer-cheap-windows-7-for-students/ |title=Microsoft offer cheap Windows 7 for students | Windows 7 Password | Forgot Windows 7 Login Password | Reset Windows 7 Administrator Password | Windows 7 Password Reset |publisher=Windows 7 Password |date=2010-09-04 |accessdate=2011-03-12}}</ref> technology [[news website]] that actively focuses on [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]], [[Macintosh|Mac]] and [[Linux]]. Neowin runs under the slogan, "Where unprofessional journalism looks better."
==History== Neowin was started as a hobby in October 2000 by Marcel Klum and Steven Parker, known within the forums as "Redmak" and "Neobond" respectively, reporting news about the Windows XP alpha and beta releases (then known as "Windows Codename Whistler").
Neowin has broken several stories, such as the [http://www.neowin.net/news/main/04/02/12/exclusive-windows-2000--windows-nt-4-source-code-leaks leak of Windows 2000 source code] onto the internet.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://slashdot.org/article.pl?sid=04/02/12/2114228 |title=Windows 2000 & Windows NT 4 Source Code Leaks |publisher=Slashdot |date=2004-02-12 |accessdate=2011-03-12}}</ref>
==Site structure== The website provides news, technology reviews, opinion articles, as well as an [[IRC]] server and forums. Over 250,000 users have registered for the forums,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.neowin.net/forum/topic/917292-neowin-welcomes-its-250000th-member-sign-up/ |title=Neowin welcomes its 250,000th member sign up - Neowin Forums |publisher=Neowin.net |date=2010-07-05 |accessdate=2011-03-12}}</ref> making over 10,000,000 posts as of April 2011. Two projects initiated by members of the Neowin community are an official game server for [[Team Fortress 2]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.neowin.net/news/meet-the-neowinian---neowin-joins-team-fortress-2 |title=Meet the Neowinian: Neowin joins Team Fortress 2 |publisher=Neowin.net |date=2010-06-20 |accessdate=2011-03-12}}</ref> and a [[Folding@Home]] team.
